lessonTopics: Lesson 1: Biblical Coaching Foundation - What faith-based coaching is, how it differs from pastoral counseling, the G.R.A.C.E. Method framework, scope of practice
Lesson 2: The G.R.A.C.E. Method - Ground in Scripture, Reflect on calling, Align with purpose, Clarify next steps, Encourage action framework for Christian coaching
Lesson 3: Getting Your First Clients - Church community strategy, pricing without guilt, income math, 30-day launch plan for faith-based practice
painPoints: Feeling called to help women spiritually but not knowing how to do it professionally
Guilt about charging money for spiritual work - believing it should be 'free ministry'
Imposter syndrome about credentials - 'Who am I without seminary training?'
Fear of judgment from church community for starting a business
Exhausted from years of unpaid volunteering while others profit from similar work
Wanting to use faith gifts but feeling trapped in 'just a church volunteer' role
Spouse or family not understanding why this is more than a hobby
terminology: Calling - God-given assignment to serve others in a specific way; your divine purpose
G.R.A.C.E. Method - Ground, Reflect, Align, Clarify, Encourage framework for biblical coaching
Stewardship - Biblical principle that our gifts are meant to be grown and multiplied, not buried
Discernment - Spirit-led wisdom for making aligned decisions; listening for God's guidance
Spiritual gifts - God-given abilities like encouragement, wisdom, teaching meant to serve others
Purpose alignment - Helping clients connect their daily life with their God-given calling
Scope of practice - Facilitating faith-aligned growth without replacing pastoral counseling or therapy
Biblical principles - Scripture-based foundations for life decisions and transformation
clientExamples: Women 40-60 in life transitions who want faith-centered guidance (divorce, empty nest, career change)
Christian women feeling spiritually dry or disconnected from their purpose
Church members who feel called to 'something more' but don't know what
Women struggling to align their career or life choices with their faith values
Believers processing grief, doubt, or major life changes through a biblical lens
Women who feel guilty about their desires and need permission to pursue their calling
practiceType: Faith-based life coaching using biblical principles, prayer, scripture application, and purpose alignment to help women live in accordance with their God-given calling
